attributes.action: Decline all nominations of Resignation Honours from former Prime Ministers.
attributes.additional_details:
In recent years, Prime Ministers have submitted Resignation Honours lists. These lists have been submitted despite the performance of the Prime Minister having negative impact on the British people (examples: Liz Truss, Boris Johnson).

The Honours Committee within the Cabinet Office has the power to reject proposed honours, and this petition is to have the Committee reject all Prime Minister's Resignation Honours it can, when proposed.
attributes.background:
The Honours Committee (within the Cabinet Office) should decline requests of Resignation Honours (over which it has oversight) from former Prime Ministers.

It might also be helpful for the Committee to publicise this change.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions relating to nominations for honours or appointments.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Reform the Honours System and make it independent of Government: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/632600
